articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Emma Farge, Sabine Siebold
articles.description: The U.S. is refusing to co-sponsor a draft U.N. resolution marking three years since Moscow's invasion of Ukraine that backs Kyiv's territorial integrity and condemns Russian aggression, in a potential stark shift by Ukraine's most powerful Western ally.
articles.title: Exclusive: US will not co-sponsor UN motion backing Ukraine

articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israel braced on Thursday for the return of the bodies of infant Kfir Bibas and his four-year-old brother Ariel, the two youngest captives taken by Hamas in their Oct. 7, 2023 attack and among the most potent symbols of the trauma inflicted that day.
articles.title: Israel prepares to receive bodies of youngest Gaza hostages

articles.author: Olena Harmash, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said he was counting on Ukrainian and European unity and U.S. pragmatism as Kyiv faces a mounting crisis in relations with its hitherto key U.S. ally.
articles.title: Zelenskiy calls for US pragmatism after Trump calls him a 'dictator'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Spain's High Court said on Thursday it had found former soccer federation boss Luis Rubiales guilty of sexual assault for kissing player Jenni Hermoso without her consent, and set a fine of over 10,000 euros ($10,434.00), but acquitted him of coercion.
articles.title: Spanish court sentences ex-soccer boss Rubiales to pay fine over kiss without consent

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Congolese army called on deserters to rejoin their units on Thursday, as rogue soldiers fired guns and looted parts of the eastern town of Lubero after fleeing nearby clashes with advancing Rwandan-backed rebels.
articles.title: Congo army runaways loot and sow panic in North Kivu town

articles.author: Manuela Andreoni, Luciana Magalhaes
articles.description: Brazilian prosecutors presented a streamlined version of charges against former President Jair Bolsonaro this week over a plot to overturn his 2022 electoral loss, which could boost the chances of a final ruling before next year's elections.
articles.title: Streamlined charges against Bolsonaro may speed case ahead of 2026 Brazil vote

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Argentine court has cleared three of the five people accused of their alleged involvement in singer Liam Payne's death, local media reported on Thursday.
articles.title: Argentina court clears 3 accused in singer Liam Payne's death

articles.author: Nate Raymond
articles.description: A group of Venezuelans filed a U.S. lawsuit challenging the Trump administration's decision to end temporary protections against deportation for hundreds of thousands of immigrants from Venezuela living in the United States.
articles.title: Venezuelans sue in US to challenge Trump's end to deportation protections

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canada's public safety minister on Thursday said the country has listed seven transnational criminal organizations as terrorist entities.
articles.title: Canada lists 7 criminal organizations as terrorist entities, minister says

articles.author: Kate Holton, Andrew Macaskill, Joe Cash
articles.description: Britain has lined up a Mandarin-speaking diplomat whose father was a governor of Hong Kong as the next ambassador to China, according to three sources, and he is expected to take up one of the most challenging roles in British diplomacy later this year.
articles.title: Exclusive: UK lines up new ambassador to help rebuild China ties
